examples: a large house not unlike Mr. Shaw's
they were unlike anything ever seen before

adjective.description: Dissimilar or different from each other.
examples: they seemed utterly unlike, despite being twins

verb.description: Be regarded with distaste or hostility; be unpopular.
examples: the article suggests that his character was unliked by many

verb.description: (in the context of social media) withdraw one's approval of or support for (someone or something one has previously liked) by means of an icon or link.
examples: I cut about 300 of my 400 friends and unliked about 20–30 pages

origin: Middle English: perhaps originally an alteration of Old Norse úlíkr; compare with Old English ungelīc not of the same kind, not comparable.
